required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Three Modalities of Spontaneous Breathing Tests on Respiratory Efforts in Tracheostomized Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Three Modalities of Spontaneous Breathing Tests on Respiratory Efforts in Tracheostomized Patients. Monocentric Crossover Interventionnal Study.

brief_summary.textblock:
Datas are lacking concerning weaning from mechanical ventilation for tracheostomized patients. In particular, the effect of different modalities of spontaneous breathing trials on respiratory effort has not been extensively described.
This crossover physiology study will include 18 tracheostomized patients ventilated for more than 72 hours.
The objective of this study is to compare the effect of three different modalities of SBTs on respiratory effort in tracheostomized patients. The modalities tested are : Pressure Support Ventilation (PSV level 5 cmH2O, PEEP 5 cmH2O), T-piece test and high-flow Oxygen. Each modality is applied in a randomized order, during 30 minutes. During every modality tested, esophageal and gastric pressure, expired CO2, and comfort will be monitored, in addition to standard monitoring. Based on esophageal pressure monitoring, patient's respiratory efforts can be calculated either by esophageal pressure-time product and work of breathing. Pressure generated by inspiratory muscles will also be assessed.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three different spontaneous breathing trials modalities will be tested in each patient in a randomized order. Washout periods will be performed between the tested modalities.

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of pressure-time product of esophageal pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Quantification of inspiratory effort of the patient

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Total area of a Campbell diagram for esophageal pressure and volume during one respiratory cycle

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum variation of esophageal pressure during respiratory cycles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure generated by patients' respiratory muscles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between gastric and esophageal pressure. Reflect of pressure generated by diaphragm during inspiration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of ratio of inspiratory time over total duration of a breathing cycle (ti/ttot)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of Rapid Shallow Breathing Index (RSBI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: RR/VT - predictor during ventilation weaning of intolerance of SBT

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Capacity of total respiratory system to gain volume for a given pressure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Capacity of lungs to gain volume for a given pressure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Capacity of lungs to gain volume for a given pressure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Alveolar pressure minus pleural pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of ratio of total dead space volume over tidal volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by means of expired CO2 and arterial blood gas CO2

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of total dead space volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by means of expired CO2

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of total Positive End-Expiratory Pressure (PEEPtot)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Airway pressure during end-expiratory ventilator occlusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Standard monitoring

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Standard monitoring

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Airway pressure during end-inspiratory ventilator occlusion (corresponds to alveolar pressure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of intrinsic Positive End-Expiratory Pressure (PEEPi)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: PEEPi minus PEEP set on ventilator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded every 5 minutes during each sequence and washout period, 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as the ratio of tidal volume over functionnal residual capacity (FRV)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Ultrasound measurement of diaphragm movement during inspiration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Ultrasound measurement of diaphragm thickening during inspiration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by arterial blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of Richmond Agitation/Sedation scale (RASS) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Used in ICU to monitor neurologic changes in patients. Scale from -5 (unarousable) to +4 (combative). 0 is a calm and responsive patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of Borg dyspnea scale score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 1 and minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Numeric scale to quantify dyspnea from 0 to 10. 0 mean patient does not feel that breathing is difficult and 10 is a maximal dyspnea. Measured twice during each Spontaneous Breathing Trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of Multidimensionnal dyspnea scale (MDP) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at minute 30 of each three spontaneous Breathing Trial, 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Score to quantify comfort, dyspnea and assess respiratory effort as perceived by patient. This scale contains multiple items, divided in two dimensions : sensory and affective. Sensory dimension contains : intensity on a scale of 0 to 10 of five sensory qualities (physical breathing effort, air hunger, tightness, mental breathing effort, hyperpnoea) Affective dimension contains : a breathing discomfort scale (scale of 0 to 10) Measured once during each Spontaneous Breathing Trial

arm_group.description: Three different 30-minute modalities of deventilation will be performed in a randomized order in each patient. Washout periods of 30 minutes will occur between tested modalities.
Three different 30-minute modalities of deventilation will be performed in a randomized order in each patient. Washout periods of 30 minutes will occur between tested modalities.

Three different 30-minute modalities of deventilation will be performed in a randomized order in each patient. Washout periods of 30 minutes will occur between tested modalities.
Three different 30-minute modalities of deventilation will be performed in a randomized order in each patient. Washout periods of 30 minutes will occur between tested modalities.
Three different 30-minute modalities of deventilation will be performed in a randomized order in each patient. Washout periods of 30 minutes will occur between tested modalities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients for whom a tracheostomy is planned
- Patients on invasive ventilation for >72 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Tracheostomy for upper airway obstruction or other disease
- Patients tracheostomized before current hospitalization
- Patients with Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) < 8/10 after cardiac arrest
- Patients with GCS < 8/10 because of primary central neurologic disease
- Patients for whom therapeutic limitations have already been decided
- Patients for whom weaning from ventilation is not an objective
- Patients suffering from myasthenia gravis
- Patients with cardiac assistance device
- Patients with medullary lesion proximal to C5
- Patients for whom nasogastric tube insertion is contraindicated
